DOC.brief_summary: The present study assesses the health-related quality of life of diabetic transmetatarstal and below-knee prosthetic user. The study design is cross-sectional with a retrospective review of patient hospital records and an assessment with patient-reported outcome measure.
DOC.brief_title: Heath-related Quality of Life of Diabetic Transmetatarsal Amputees and Below-knee Prosthetic Users
DOC.detailed_description: The present study aims to recruit 100 diabetic transmetatarsal and below-knee prosthetic user to assess the health-related quality of life (HRQoL) between these two patient groups. The 15D HRQoL instrument is applied. An additional comparison with the age-standardized Finnish general population will be performed.
DOC.criteria: Patients with diabetes Transmetatarsal amputation Belowknee prosthetic user 25 years from surgery No diabetes Other than transmetatarsal or belowknee amputation Belowknee amputation but not a belowknee prosthetic user Less than 2 years from the amputation Over 5 years from amputation
